intro: Eleocharis punctata, commonly known as the punctate spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a small, herbaceous plant that typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and other moist environments. The plant has slender, grass-like stems and produces small, spike-like clusters of flowers. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly rough texture. Eleocharis punctata is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and improve water quality.
